alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Henry; Madison; Randolph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 12:12AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Madison, Delaware, western Randolph and northern Henry Counties through 1245 AM EDT... At 1212 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Muncie, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Madison, Delaware, western Randolph and northern Henry Counties, including the following locations... Summit Lake State Park, Springport, Farmland, Eaton, Ball State University, Selma, Prairie Creek Reservoir, Daleville, Parker City and Blountsville. This includes Interstate 69 between mile markers 227 and 238. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
